soc.message
Class NewGameWithOptions

java.lang.Object
  soc.message.Message
      soc.message.MessageTemplate2s
          soc.message.NewGameWithOptions
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class NewGameWithOptions
extends MessageTemplate2s

This broadcast message from server announces a new game, with a certain version and possibly game options, to all clients.

  • This message is followed by JOINGAMEAUTH to the requesting client, so they will join the game they just created.
Introduced in 1.1.07; check server version against VERSION_FOR_NEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS before sending this message.

Game name may include a prefix marker if the client can't join; see Games.MARKER_THIS_GAME_UNJOINABLE. This marker will be retained within the game name returned by MessageTemplate2s.getGame().

Just like NEWGAME, robot clients don't need to know about or handle this message type.

Since:
1.1.07
Author:
Jeremy D. Monin
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

VERSION_FOR_NEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS

public static final int VERSION_FOR_NEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS
Minimum version (1.1.07) of client/server which recognize and send NEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS and other messages related to GameOption.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

NewGameWithOptions

public NewGameWithOptions(java.lang.String ga,
                          java.lang.String optstr,
                          int minVers)
Create a NewGameWithOptions message.

Parameters:
ga - the name of the game; may have the Games.MARKER_THIS_GAME_UNJOINABLE prefix. minVers also designates if the game is joinable.
optstr - Requested game options, in the format returned by GameOption.packOptionsToString(opts, false), or null
minVers - Minimum client version required for this game, or -1.

NewGameWithOptions

public NewGameWithOptions(java.lang.String ga,
                          java.util.Hashtable opts,
                          int minVers)
Create a NewGameWithOptions message.

Parameters:
ga - the name of the game; may have the Games.MARKER_THIS_GAME_UNJOINABLE prefix. minVers also designates if the game is joinable.
opts - Hashtable of game options, or null
minVers - Minimum client version for this game, or -1. Ignored if sent from client to server. Calculated at server and sent out to all clients.
Method Detail

getOptionsString

public java.lang.String getOptionsString()
Returns:
the options for the new game, in the format returned by GameOption.packOptionsToString(opts, false), or null if no options

getMinVersion

public int getMinVersion()
Returns:
the game's minimum required client version, or -1. This is when sending from server to all clients.

minVers - Minimum client version required, or -1

getMinimumVersion

public int getMinimumVersion()
Minimum version where this message type is used. NEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS introduced in 1.1.07 for game-options feature.

Overrides:
getMinimumVersion in class Message
Returns:
Version number, 1107 for JSettlers 1.1.07.
